alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Castro; Cochran; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Lynn; Parmer; Terry; Yoakum (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 8:49PM CDT until April 12 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHWESTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE AND MOST OF THE SOUTH PLAINS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHWESTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE AND MOST OF THE SOUTH PLAINS... * Wind...Southwest at 25 to 35 mph at the 20 foot level with gusts to 65 mph Tuesday and west-northwest at 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph Wednesday. * Humidity...As low as 6 percent Tuesday and as low as 3 percent Wednesday. * Fuels...Extremely dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged. Conditions could be particularly dangerous on Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or already occurring. These conditions can create rapid wildfire growth. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Monitor later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Bailey; Castro; Cochran; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Lynn; Parmer; Terry; Yoakum
